website_summaries.verdict: This case is well made and features a look customers love, as well as an impressive cable management system. Has earned more happy customers than complaints.
pros: Has built-in smart technology that controls the RGB LED lighting and fans
Earns praise for its beautiful looks, due in part to the sleek tempered glass panel
cons: Some quirks with the CAM software have been reported
Airflow may not be adequate for some systems

customer_reviews.title: RGB CONTROLLING SOFTWARE DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: The software "Cam+" is easily the worst and most frustrating software to try and use. While open in the background it takes up 10 percent CPU Usage (Im on an 8600k) and the RGB Presets do not work. The case is useless to me right now as the LEDs do not work due to the buggy software. I have been back and forth with NZXT support for the past 4 days and they have yet to give me a solution. STAY AWAY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Riona Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Ok hear me out
customer_reviews.text: So imagine this right, I have a mother board. And if your anyone like me you’d be asking yourself “where the heck am I gonna put this baby into?” And boy oh boy guess where I put it. INTO THIS CASE! Wild right? This very case! Oh man it was insane, I had my board, and I put it, inthiscase. Are you following me? I slapped it into this bad boy and WOAH now it was in the case. Gosh it’s such a good case, hold my motherboard just fine. TLDR good case, nice panel, fans are coolio, good price, would want some rgb or lights on the inside but I guess that’s what the H500i is for
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Mean and clean
customer_reviews.text: For the past (almost) two years now I've been running my rig out of the gamer-y-est case imaginable. Lots of curves and glossy plastic paneling. That case came with a ludicrous amount of fans to make up for the poor airflow inside. This case took only an hour or two to transfer everything except my cd/DVD drive into and had such nice airflow that the my rig is virtually silent 24/7 (even before updating my fan profiles on the required software.) Its so quiet that I've found myself checking the fans through the tempered glass window to make sure they're still spinning. Good case, lots of options for easy cable management too.
customer_reviews.author: MiddleMan

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional case, fits in home office cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Following the many reviews, I selected this case for my new computer build, keeping only my OS-SSD-drive and one data drive. Purchased with i9-8700, 32 GB DRAM, Optima memory (which I did not use because I had enough $ to get another SSD drive). Arrives well-packed with plenty of foam/plastic on glass to ensure a perfect appearance. Build went extremely smoothly, following the included step-by-step instructions. Plenty of cable management space, even for the final 2 SSDs and 3 hard drives (hey if you got'em layin around, use 'em!). LEDs from existing graphics card and case back-lighting is enough for me. Exceptional cooling airflows, even in the cabinet. (The GPU is the only real space heater.) Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: I would've loved to use this case. It has great room for cable management and lots of different openings throughout the case to run cords almost anywhere you would need to. Nice design however my tempered glass broke off of the side mount the very first time I tightened it. For this type of money I'd rather spend a few more dollars for a higher end case that will actually handle the assembly process without breaking. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: JAMS

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this case along with all new parts for a new PC. This case was a nightmare to try and navigate, and it produced random incompatibilities with my motherboard and graphics card. Save your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a vertical mount GPU and its solid for that. Firmly holds the card in place. Has great cable management, fan support, and single cable to connect everything in the case to the motherboard. Was one of the easiest installs i've done. One thing i'll point out to others is ... this case, with the glass window, is not great for vertical mount GPUs because it puts the GPU right against the glass with no room for air to escape. My RTX 2080 TI runs at about 75 degrees idle, and 86 while gaming in this position... vs about 65 horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it does the job. Build quality is there for sure, good job NZXT. But if you're looking for good airflow, this ain't your best pick. Don't put anything like a 9900K or a 3900X in it that's for sure. I've got an R7 2700 in mine, I would not go any higher than that if you want to keep your CPU temps down. GPU runs a little warm too, I've got an EVGA GTX 1070 TI FTW2 and it idles around 40C. A bit toasty. Use it for a productivity build, not for serious gaming.
customer_reviews.author: k.grass

customer_reviews.title: The #1 Best Case for $70
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Computer Science student, Mac User, but have been wanting to build myself a PC for a few years now. I've been doing tons of research for my build and I can say that this case is BY FAR, the best case you can get for the value. The tool-free screws to remove the glass pane or the back-panel is a fantastic idea, just don't overtighten. I hear many complaints about the lack of CD/DVD drive bays, but let's be real... It's 2019. Discs are quickly becoming obsolete. You won't need one. Love that it comes with two fans already installed. Overall, not a single complaint. Perfect size, looks fantastic, can't wait to complete my build!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Case w/ Clean Aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It has a nice minimalist look. The design is excellent for cable management. Material quality is good. Overall, I'm very satisfied. CONS: The screws for the side panels aren't great. Case comes w/ 2x 120mm fans instead of 1x 120mm and 1x 140mm fan. The rear exhaust of the case only supports a 120mm fan but the top exhaust opening is larger and should have had a 140mm fan installed.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype.
customer_reviews.text: It sure lives up to all the hype. I particularly love the front panel connector being in one connector. It saves so much time! Compatibility with ASUS hero max X is a bit off. The io shield just can’t align perfectly and the MB is about 0.5mm off in the top left screw hole. The smart device is easy to use and connect. Be mindful that it takes one usb connector. If you have a kraken that’s another one. But the front panel doesn’t seem to have a usb2.0 connector so you actually get away without needing an extension hub. Overall good quality product, sleek design. Worth one Benjamin.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: NZXT is at the top of their game with the H series cases. I have an H200i and H500i because the RGB lighting and CAM software is really awesome. You can set this thing up to match and sort of lighting and color scheme you can imagine, or completely disable it as well. I bought this one because the ITX version couldn't fit my EVGA RTX 2070 and the switch over process was seamless. With how much space this has, I feel like I need to fill it up with SSD's and fans etc. If you're contemplating buying this case, just pull the trigger. It's great and you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Redux

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to set up my rig with this tower. After upgrading my parts and downsizing from the Phantom -- this was a piece of cake. My only ultra minor problem is that there are no lights or raised markings for the mic and headset jacks on the top of the tower. I frequently have to swap my headset between computers and it is mildly annoying that it isn't easier to determine which is which without a flashlight to shine on the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice case.  Well thought out
customer_reviews.text: I was going for a gaming computer on the cheap, but not too cheap. This case was not terribly expensive and touted good cable management. Well it did not disappoint. Well thought out, with a good location for the CPU radiator. Good room for components and easy to route the cables behind the rear panel. I got compliments on the cleanliness of the build. I would recommend this case for others. In fact I have another project I am starting an this will most likely be the case I use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This case is amazing, coming from a Corsair Carbide 300r, this case is only $20 more and comes packed with way more features. From its smart fan hub to LED lighting to cable management solutions, this case was an absolute pleasure to build in. One thing though, with my Corsair H80i v2, I had to place the radiator with one fan on the front bottom mount due to interference with the cable rail. Not a big deal, but it all fits, even with an EVGA GTX 1080 Ti FTW3. Don’t hesitate to buy this case if you’re in the market for one! Absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sleek RGB tower
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this to build a new work/gaming computer.. he loves that it is sleek looking, has tempered glass and that it has RGB. The RGB has different light settings/features. The fans are extremely quiet. This tower is overall beautiful and great for its value!! I husband would definitely buy this again and he recommends it!
customer_reviews.author: ChattieChandler

customer_reviews.title: has its pros and cons - not sure if its just me though
customer_reviews.text: PROS: cool lights, sleek case, great cable management CONS: not sure if its just my case but the glass, rear fan, and bottom plastic dust screen makes vibration noises from time to time (have to push on them to get it to stop or use thin foam), if you have other led fans the smart control may make them flicker. The smart software is cool just have to see how long the case will last.
customer_reviews.author: MATT

customer_reviews.title: Look before you leap!
customer_reviews.text: Good case. Used it to build my first pc and I am pleased. Stays cool if fans are mounted properly. Wished it had a bay for an optical drive (which is doesn't), but that's on me for forgetting I need an optical drive. With my layout I had enough room for two AIO water coolers (120 mm for the cpu and 140 mm for the gpu with the Kraken G12 Bracket). Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: masterkey

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing, M2 heatsink screw breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, very good looking case, and it was easy enough to work with, aside from it being too tight at the top of the mother board. It really made it difficult to get the CPU power lead plugged in up there. I'd recommend plugging that in before screwing the motherboard into the case, as the CPU fan makes it almost impossible to get the lead plugged in (although I did finally get it plugged in). Also, do not over-tighten the m2 heatsink. The screw is super flimsy, and mine broke off. It's the only thing that I'm really disappointed about as far as purchasing this is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Tod S.

customer_reviews.title: Sleek looking case with performance to back it
customer_reviews.text: Best case I have ever had. Very happy with this purchase. I know that RGB does literally nothing for the computer's performance, however it looks really nice and turns my computer into an art piece. My CPU and GPU remain cool under load. I had a 16 hour game session with the lighting set up to tell me when my GPU got to 80C and it got up to that heat maybe once or twice. The case is super quiet as well, overall I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Such a Great Value Case
customer_reviews.text: Quick secure shipping! This case was up against the phanteks p350 for me personally but ultimately i decided to go with the nzxt 500 here. It was a good choice for my mid to lower end build. Its a really easy case to build in with built in routing paths in the rear panel cable management is far from a chore & quite enjoyable actually. As for the temps there is a grilled ventilation on the rear side. other than that there is space for an AIO RAD in front and four fans in the case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade from the OEM case. Runs quiet and cool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case as an upgrade to the OEM case used for a Cybertron PC that I never cared for. The quality of this case is top notch. The supplied fans run cool and quiet, the PC overall runs cool and quiet as well. Honestly I can not fault this case in anyway. Every upgrade I have done to the PC since the transfer of components has been a smooth and easy task. Very pleased to have purchased this case.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case to build in
customer_reviews.text: Wire channels are a huge benefit. Overall a treat to build in. Features more common with high end cases for peasant prices. My only complaint is the fan/vent on top rattled against the included vinyl filter. This can be remedied by removing the filter or pulling the filter tight while tightening fan down. Honestly I wish they had just left this out as it feels out of place and looks cut in like an after thought.
customer_reviews.author: BigAL

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case. (I regret not getting the white!) My only issue with this case is that when the tempered glass panel is on, it restricts airflow a little bit. Not to the point that components reach extremely high temperatures but I enough that the fans have to increase RPM and start humming a little. So if you're looking for a case that is a good balance between aesthetics and performance, this is the case for you. If performance is all you care about, I'd look at a better ventilated case or just keep the tempered glass panel off when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Bendokas

customer_reviews.title: Case fans are meh.
customer_reviews.text: i like this case, i do, but i can’t say i’d recommend it for the price. The cable management isn’t the greatest, but it’s really good, i just prefer the rubber cutouts instead. But for $100 it isn’t terrible, the led rgb lights are very high quality and bright, and also hidden, which is really nice. However the biggest downside to me for this case, is the fans. They. Are. Loud. And i mean loud. they aren’t 5 year old ps4 loud, but they’re not far behind it. If you get this case, get you some new fans for your case.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great visually and organizationally
customer_reviews.text: My first see-through case and it is amazing. I never understood the hype around LED's in a computer case, but having a case that you can see through changes everything. I definitely plan to add some more LED's later this year to take full advantage of the case. The organization on the case is also very handy. One of my cleanest cable managements with the majority of the cables secured out of sight (exception for motherboard which would have done a 90' angle if routed under the bar instead of over).
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very pleasant case to build with.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a micro-ATX build I had in mind so I had some growing room, which there is plenty of. Steel construction is thin but feels incredibly sturdy, along with the glass panel it has the minimalist look that was described. The cable management support on the backside of the case is simple but includes a few channels with velcro to hold it against the case itself. The only thing I had an issue with was adding more 3.5'' storage after the build was done because of my own cable management, whereas the SSD slots are out in the open for easy access. But I'm probably the only person using 3.5" mechanical drives anymore, anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Max Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite cases by far
customer_reviews.text: This is a great successor to the s340 case that I had loved when I made my first computer. NZXT did a wonderful job keeping the ascthetics traits and bringing them to this case, especially with already laid LED strips in the top. This is a very clean and modern case that can go well with almost any color scheme and looks better with the RGB NZXT fans they make. Only complaint is that the air intake in the front is a bit small and has no removable front so good fans that can pull air are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Case
customer_reviews.text: Has acres of room. You could easily fit a 3 fan strix card in it if you wanted to. It as 2 2.5 inch trays and 2 3.5 inch Hard drive bay with mounting holes for 2.5 inch ssds. Cable managing is easy. Can fit almost any power supply you want. Can fit a 280 mm radiator. Arrives with two NZXT fans installed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case. Functional. Customer support was beyond expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately after buying this case I was tweaking the config inside, and repeatedly taking the glass panel off and putting it back on. At one point it slipped out of my hands and shattered on my glass desktop. Must have hit it just right. NZXT did not even hesitate to offer a free replacement when I live chatted with them. They were super friendly and didn't even question the request, despite it being my fault for dropping it. Excellent customer service and product!
customer_reviews.author: StephieB

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but GPU overheats
customer_reviews.text: This case looks awesome. That’s why I got it. But after mounting my GPU vertically, it overheated when playing games. It got to 80 degrees c my pc crashed. If I remove the glass panel, it runs ok, never above 50 C. Either you have to run your GPU horizontally or remove the glass. It looks great with the lights and with my water cooled CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Okay case.
customer_reviews.text: Case is okay, material quality is decent. The top of the case can only fit one 120mm fan so not good for watercooling, front of the case does not come off so also not good for any cooling. Overall this case is not good for cooling. I almost broke the pre installed fans trying to move the cords around this mess of a case everything is so tight it has less space than my small tower wtf. Nice to look at case but get the h200 or the h700 as they support better cooling capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: It has cable management in mind when they built the case because there are many great locations where you can discretely run your cables through. It has two usb 3.0 connectors at the front which is nice and the tempered glass looks great. However, it might be my inexperience at building new rigs, but I did run into some problems trying to get my motherboard screwed in tightly to the case because the screws the manual told me to use did not fit well. Overall great case for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Torres

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!
customer_reviews.text: This case was a dream to build in. I used it for my first build and my pc looks great. very open with lots of room to work with. The back makes cable management pretty easy. i was pretty intimidated by the cables when i was finished building but the channels and the large space next to the power supply made cable management a breeze. There are 2 light strips pre installed and they look great. glass looks nice. everything about this case is super solid.
customer_reviews.author: SpicyPepe

customer_reviews.title: Nice case but nothing worked
customer_reviews.text: Case is nice but nothing worked. The fans didn't spin the LED's didn't light up. Of course I find this out after putting all my components inside. Well support started off great and sent me a new controller. Fans now work, LED's don't. I reach out explain the situation, and they send 1 strip even though both didn't work. I am over it at this point but quite disappointing experience overall. At least it still looks pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Yageaholic

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this case is very nice. The tray for the front mount liquid cooler is very convenient, took me a few minutes to figure out the best way to install my cooler in this thing but it didn't take long. The stock push/pull fans don't perform super well if you're using your machine for 4K gaming (hot CPU & GPU temps), so if you are building a high-performance system would recommend upgrading push/pull fans. That being said, I will definitely be getting this same case for when I build my dads PC.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Meier

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the H500 If you’re looking for an affordable, tempered glass, minimalistic case... look no further. Build quality is good, can fit ATX MOBO, large graphics cards, and still has room for AIO loop. Only issue I had, was one standoff, didn’t quite lineup with the MOBO mounting hole, so I couldn’t get that one screw in, other than that, it was an easy build, that looks incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Me Tell U

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad case, just wasn't what I needed at the time. System unfortunately suffered from higher then wanted temps, but that was likely due to lack of airflow in the case. Overall, if not building a high end air cooled system, this might be the case for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Wow! NZXT out did themselves!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't have been more impressed with this case and it's design. Build quality is great, almost no assembly required, very spacious, preinstalled cable management system (such a time saver), vertical mount for water cooler which makes so much sense, SSD mounts on the back side of motherboard mount (super smart), and glass panel is sturdy! They definitely took their time and implemented smart design techniques with this case! Only thing I'm having issues with is hooking up the preinstalled light strips inside case! Other than that, 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Cooper C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build in!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect case. Easy to build in. Highly recommend for first time builders. Feels high quality at a good price. The built in cable management system in the back combined with how much room you have in this case makes it very easy to work with. I also like that the glass panel removes with one thumb screw. The back panel has two thumb screws and is easy to open as well. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: gluis2k

customer_reviews.title: Pure joy to work in
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case to transfer my motherboard from a Dell XPS 8500 into it so I could use a physically & electrically bigger power supply and a physically larger video card than what the OEM case allowed. I appreciate that NZXT even supplies a front panel adapter extensions to separate out the front panel plug. I recommend this case to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: mauirixxx

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist & Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This case is just what you want if you're looking for a minimalist approach to your pc build. Industrial design; all metal case, with RGB lighting and a tempered glass side panel. You might need MB, CPU and GPU extension cables; PSU is mounted in the bottom of chassis, so this might be an issue if you intend to use the cable routing channels for a clean look. Good news is there are kits available in many color schemes that will allow for an extremely nicely finished PC. Great case!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: First pc build and I gotta say this case makes for a easy clean build. The integrated lighting is awesome and easy to use with the software. The fans included are wired to the same cam module and include fan splitters already attached, so that was nice. The only thing I wish it included was more cutout slots, or at least a larger one, on the bottom plate that sits above the psu. Psu and hdd bracket sit underneath that plate, and things can get pretty tight. Just takes some extra time managing cables. Awesome case, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this case. Highly.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man! This is a great case, its stylish and is packed with techy goodness! The airflow inside the case is amazing, as are the included fans. The CAM controller works very, very well. The outside aesthetic is perfect, its not "in your face" but it does make its presence known! It has a lot of room for custom loops, as well as all in one loops. Its fantastic! No cons, none. Zero.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the 2nd Arrived the 4th.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered and paid for. I actually rushed to buy one due to the fact they were selling out but Amazon restocked it within the month it seemed. I liked the look of the case, especially the clean look of the glass panel. The very few things I disliked about the case were: A, the slots for the graphic cards could be a cm taller. B, the power light floods into the first USB port (maybe add a small piece of plastic to block it?) C, add the option to include 1 or 2 extra 2.5" HDD/SSD bracket(s.) These problems we're very minor and shouldn't affect anyone's decision about buying this amazing case from NZXT.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Beatiful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It looks super sexy sitting on my desk and is fairly easy to get into when I need to work on my PC. My only complaint is that the cable management features didn't really work well for my build, so I have a mess of cables in the small space behind the motherboard. It is particularly difficult to get power cables to the side of the motherboard on the top of the case, specifically for me the CPU power cable.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great looks, sub-par airflow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case as an upgrade to my heavily scratched S340. My thoughts on it are actually quite positive. Pros: Vertical GPU support RGB strips pre-installed Tempered glass side panel Cons: Cable management not as simple as my old S340 Some motherboard standoffs came loose as I was tightening my motherboard Airflow is pretty "meh"
customer_reviews.author: Dash W.

customer_reviews.title: Just got it but it looks beautiful. But there is one problem
customer_reviews.text: I'm transferring my pc components to this new case. The case looks beautiful and is up and running now. There is 1 problem though, and the reason I took 1 star as well. There is a scratch about an inch on the sleeve or whatever that is called. anyway, I attached the photo of the scratch. I just ignored it though cause I already took off all the parts from my old case when I noticed it, so too bad for me. anyway looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Paint isn't that great on it
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a couple of months now, it's a nice case for the price, I built my husbands computer system so we'd be able to customize it, it's excellent quality however the outside of the case is already starting to wear and it doesn't go anywhere except the office. The paint is wearing off, overall excellent though.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: No accesories
customer_reviews.text: THE DESCRIPTION ON THIS ITEM WAS USED IN VERY GOOD CONDITION, BUT ALL WE GOT WAS THE CASE WITHOUT ANY ACCESSORIES (SCREWS, NUTS, ETC). THE EASY ACCESS PANEL TAKES SPECIAL THUMB SCREWS (THIN THREAD WITH A BIG HEAD TO MANIPULATE) WERE MISSING. SO WE JUST GOT A BARE CASE PERIOD, NOT HAPPY ABOUT IT. WE HAD TO IMPROVISE WITH OUR OWN HARDWARE, WASN'T WORTHED TO CONTACT THE SELLER AS WE HAD THE OTHER COMPONENTS TO BUILD THE PC. SO BUYERS BEWARE OF "USED VERY GOOD" STUFF.
customer_reviews.author: datruis

customer_reviews.title: Tempered Glass is cracked!
customer_reviews.text: I opened up the case and saw that the tempered glass panel was cracked. Probably damaged in transit. That shouldn’t happen though. Otherwise, this is a pretty good case for beginners who are building their first PC. Nice cable management, all the motherboard stand-offs are already installed for you, and all the cables for the fans & front I/O are tied down and consolidated when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis P.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, terrible thermals
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a 2080 ti and 9900k in here, and the thermals are terrible. GPU regularly hits 85C because the intakes in the front just don't cut it. Going to have to buy a new case and rebuild my PC. It sucks because I love the look of this case and the built in RGB strips, but I can't have this thing burn my card up for looks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Case! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re thinking of getting this case, go for it. Great cable management, rgb strips light it up great as well. Very user friendly as far as installation goes. The glass panel is so big it makes it look like there is nothing there. I put 3 additional fans in mine which are also RGB and it turned out great. The specs on my pc are as follows: GPU: GTX 980Ti CPU: I7 6700k Motherboard: MSI Z170A RAM: 16gb DDR4 Storage 1: 120gb crucial SSD Storage 2: 1tb 7200rpm Hard Drive Case:NZXT H500i Power Supply: EVGA 750W GQ
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: LEDs not working properly
customer_reviews.text: This case is very well build and easy to work in but I have 1 problem with it. The two included LED strips are not working properly. The one above the side panel only has 4 of the LEDs working. Three of them are blue and one is red (I installed the NZXT CAM software to make all the LEDs red but they stay the same color). The flexible one does not turn on no matter what I try to do. Over all, I'm not extremely happy with the way this case turns out to be but it is still very easy to work in.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Power button is faulty
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this case for the last 6 months or so, and lately I've been seeing a problem where pushing the power button never works on the first try. I've tried reconnecting to the motherboard to no avail. It seems to be a problem with the button itself, as pushing the button multiple times will usually get the PC up and running. This was never a problem until recently, but it is hard to recommend this case with such an annoying problem.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Its Decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my very first pc build and was pleasantly surprised by the sleek design and cable management. I'm really happy with its delivery and functionality. My only complaint is with their quality control. As soon as all my parts were correctly installed in the case I noticed a noticeably ugly scratch on the tampered glass. Pretty disappointing when you always expect the best from new purchases. The included fans are also pretty noisy, ill probably look at getting them replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fan noise.
customer_reviews.text: The case quality for this price point seems ok, not great, but not awful. That being said, the rear fan started vibrating and making noise within a week. Contacted NZXT and they shipped out a replacement fan, and what do you know, the second fan makes noise too (although quieter than the original).
customer_reviews.author: Neil C.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great case, I had a little issue when I wasn't trying to install the NZXT Kraken X62 280mm. I installed it on the front but I had to kind of rig it to get it to fix right. But that's not an issue with the case, that was more of an issue with me buying something that wasn't really meant to fit their.
customer_reviews.author: SarpyJr

customer_reviews.title: To purrty not to look at
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog and there is some smoking in the house so the focus on airflow and filtered intakes is really pleasing. I'm really happy with this build. I heard a YouTuber gripe about the thumb screws not being thumb tight and they were but I'm more than happy with my case coming assembled and solid. It satisfies the perfectionist in me. I'm having a hard time gaming or keeping my eyes on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: Looks is good, case design for installtion is also good, case cable management is excellent
customer_reviews.text: NZXT is a very well known case maker and for a good reason. Their cases are very modernly design and its interior is crafted that allows users to install their components with ease. Their cable management is on point and they provide the necessary tools and ties for you to continue that; I think for its price it is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price, easy cable management, but gets a bit warm
customer_reviews.text: The fan setup isn't bad, but it's definitely not the best. However, the cable management in this case is really great. It looks superb as well. If I had one big complaint, it's the tightness of the PSU area. It's quite a squeeze to try to get in to add another hard drive, which I will be doing very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Grelewicz

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty, kind of hard to build in
customer_reviews.text: I love the overall look and feel of the case. It is very sleek and matches the aesthetic I was going for. However, it was a bit hard to build in, with mounting an SSD in the front and connecting cables being hard due to the small amount of space. That could be contributed to the fact that this was my first build and that I made many mistakes, but many of the gaps were still very small.
customer_reviews.author: mebercs

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case.
customer_reviews.text: This was the only case I wanted for my build. Nothing even came close in my mind. The only difference from what I saw in reviews was how you open the side tempered glass. I thought there was a button/release switch but, on mine you just unscrew and pull. No big deal. I loved the easy to connect switches. Really every case should be this user friendly to build in.
customer_reviews.author: Cajunblood

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: Great case, quiet fans, tempered glass and great cable management. What more can you ask for except for clearer instructions for beginners. Also it doesnt have a reset switch or usb 2.0 so don't freak out like i did.
customer_reviews.author: Excalibur

customer_reviews.title: Great case no problems
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a “like new - used” item from the amazon warehouse. Came the next day, box was destroyed (they mentioned that in the description so no surprise there) but the case itself was brand new and never used. Still had all the plastic and accessories untouched. There was a small dent maybe about the size of a pinky finger tip but goes unnoticed unless you’re really looking for it. Other than that it’s a great case, thermals are good and looks amazing. Definitely would buy again or the h510 when it’s released
customer_reviews.author: j.Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and sexy
customer_reviews.text: Everything fit inside the case really well, and there were plenty of places to facilitate cable management. The glass side panel is the easiest thing to remove and reattach. The led strip is bright, and the design is sleek and functional. I love the addition of the vertical option for mounting the GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B.

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 2
customer_reviews.text: I got the h500 and h500i. I like them both. I didn't think I would use the i's integrated lighting but I actually really like it. It is really easy to organize the wires on the back and make a clean build with this case. I think my major problem was that at the top of the case the gap is very small to pass through fan connectors/male ends.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Nothing exceptional, or worth raving about, as that's mostly left up to what you add inside. But overall, the case looks good, and built well. Mine arrived safely, with no damage. And it's going to be a WiP for me, so I can't say much about spacing, and all that. But from the other reviews I read on it before I made my purchase. It has sufficient space for the majority of builds. So I'm not worried about that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service! Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case. Cable management is wonderful. Looks clean and sleek. Great build quality. Airflow is good if you set it up for negative pressure (top and rear exhaust fans). After watching some reviews, learned its pointless to use front intake fans. There aren't enough vents in the front for airflow. Bought this in blue/black. Didnt really like the blue, so i emailed NZXT support and asked if i could purchase a blacn cable bar to make the whole thing black. They mailed me the black bar for FREE! Just had to provide proof of purchase. 10/10 customer service NZXT! THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case for any build. The integrated case fans and built-in cable management system are a huge plus. The concept of one module that controls fans, LEDs, and the front panel makes building so much easier and saves a lot of headache. The drive bay in the back is also great. My only problem is that I bought a Micro ATX motherboard so I had move and remove a lot of standoffs. Plus all the different kinds of screws can be confusing. Other than that it's a super simple and well made case.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Rysavy

customer_reviews.title: High quality, sleek and stylish, well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first build and this was a case I felt unworthy of because it is honestly bad a#%. Well worth the purchase, very high quality. I have had no issues with the products I have installed and I have been running it for almost a year. The drivers are easy to install and it shows you all of your running stats on the NZXT app that pops up on my screen every time I turn on my PC. Fun and easy to edit LED lighting inside if you want it(includes every shade of color, basically), or simply turn off LED lighting. Needless to say, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: Great PC Case
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product, so that I could build my second PC. This case was perfect. First off, it has glass on the outside allowing you to see the led strips, fan lights, and any other rgb parts you have in your PC. Both the glass panel and other panel are easy to remove allowing you to clean it with ease. The case has plenty of room allowing you to install your computer parts without worry of messing the parts up. If I had to choose a pc case again, I would choose this one any day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The case came in excelent condition and is very well built. I would have preferred the white version but seeing as its out of stock I ordered the black one. To be fair it looks much better in person and CPU temps are very cool. Plenty of space in the front to add a rad.
customer_reviews.author: Yaniv

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for keeping parts cool.
customer_reviews.text: Case is cheap low grade metal and glass panel is tight so i am worried that will break some time. No real space for anything other than a SSD drive as the hard drive bay is tiny with limited ventilation. Cooling is acheived via a tiny vent on the side. I moved my build back to an older case and saw temp drops in the case by 20 degrees. I regret purchasing this case. If you are a system builder avoid this case.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J.

customer_reviews.title: Case is nice but software for controlling lights is buggy
customer_reviews.text: The case looks great! The controller is a bit buggy and will shut off the fans in the case sometimes and not turn them back on. Ensured the correct software was installed and updated. W10 x64. Plugged case fans directly into mobo to circumvent issue. RGB looks good!
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: Great Case - Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing case. Love the color scheme and ended up putting Corsair fans in it. Easy to work on and easy setup too. Just installed a new PSU and had no issues. Top of case has a chip out of it, but nothing bad - must have hit it somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Case
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty impressed by this case, it looks flawlessly, it was really easy for the cable management because on the back side where you hide all the cable you have a guide line where you can follow to set all your components, lightnings are really great, even the different modes and modification you can do to them using the APP.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Eduardo Vilar

customer_reviews.title: Check before you build
customer_reviews.text: Received case and really appreciated the instruction being so user friendly and the case having many of the parts and screws needed to build a new pc. Unfortunately the case was a little bang up upon arrival and the second usb ports was unusable, damaged beyond repairer but I only mad that discovered after I had completed the pc build other then the damage vary well mad case for a new pc build.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: 100% great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this case so much. This is the best case I have ever owned or seen in person. I highly suggest their products. I would buy again if I was building another PC. It seems to have great circulation. The wires and display work well. I am very happy with everything when all is said and done.
customer_reviews.author: FluffyFingersMD

customer_reviews.title: Kick @$$
customer_reviews.text: Great case, fans are perfect. The build is easy to work with and great for any first timers. Clean sleek look with a blue stripe makes everything look sweet. Next build I'll be going with an H200 though. I like small yet powerful builds. Small fast builds sell better, pro tip.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Colors not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The description says Orange/Black/White - The Black is more like Dark Grey - the dimensions listed are smaller than the actual case size.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, had trouble with LEDs at first but was able to fix
customer_reviews.text: I Love the way the case is designed. Its quite beautiful and is exactly what i wanted. I went from a larger case to this one and couldnt be happier with the experience. Since im using the NZXT x62 which takes up my usb 2.0 header i had to buy the NZXT usb header extension which was a little inconvenient. After installing it I still had trouble with the LEDs in the case, but after about an hour of tinkering, wiggling some cables was all i needed to do apparently. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bogdon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case, Bit of a Tight Fit Though
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Love the LEDs and being able to sync them in different ways. My only complaints are that getting the mobo in was one hell of a tight fit. I even got the mobo stuck under the NZXT bar on the right hand side. Also, the way you have to put your storage in makes replacing drives a pain in the ass as you have to unscrew the entire bay from the bottom and then unscrew the individual drives from that piece as opposed to my old CoolerMaster case that had bays you could slide in and out with a "snap-in" feature.
customer_reviews.author: heartparade

customer_reviews.title: Very spacious for a mid tower.
customer_reviews.text: This tower has a lot of room because it has no bays for cd drives. That being said. Make sure if you are installing windows you are doing it from a usb drive since you can't put a cd drive in. The extra space was needed to fit a new video card.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case
customer_reviews.text: The tempered glass is not colored at all and crystal clear, just looks like an open case. The RGB is amazing, like a clown threw up on overpriced computer components. Very easy to work in this case, cable management system is the best I've seen in a case so far. It has no flex at all when empty/open and feels sturdy. It's a simple black box, I respect NZXT for that... your components are what you want to show off so a bunch of stuff and nonsense on your case takes away from that.
customer_reviews.author: Blueberry Jelly

customer_reviews.title: Love the look
customer_reviews.text: The glass panel looks great. Plenty of slots to route your cords for a clean look. USB connections on top and back. It would be nice to have some on the bottom front, but not a big issue. I bought a black and white one also and they both look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: This case is good but...
customer_reviews.text: This case is good but it has got some problems. First of all, The case came scratched and I was really hyped for my first build so I didn't feel like waiting and RMA'(ing) it so I ignored the scratches and Just covered one with a really good sticker. Second, this case gets scratched by the tiniest hit. When my chair hits the case it leaves a sign that is hard to take off and I fell like the material of the outer case should be better.BUT this case is awesome in the cable management wise and I would recommend it or the newer case (h510) that should be releasing at the same price (it's sold at 69$)
customer_reviews.author: Moha

customer_reviews.title: I got the complete wrong product, but the actual product is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought from a used seller and got a similar looking case that was orange and all beat up. After ordering from the official website I was really satisfied with this case. It has many thumb screws on the outside for easy access to the inside and is very easy to hide all of the ugly things to make your build as clean as possible. I'm 14 and this was my first ever pc and I am very happy about how easy it was with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Kolby Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great case!  Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So much to be said for this case. Im very happy with mine now thats its all put together. The lighting and diagnostic rig that it comes with is impressive to say the least. There were a lot of little design things while putting it together that made me go, “oh wow they really thought about that.” The wire management is super nice. The overall look and feel is impressive. The build is quality. I feel like this is a jackpot case.
customer_reviews.author: ZStarnes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install parts into and good cable management
customer_reviews.text: Overall the case is solid and easy to work parts into. Plenty of space to move around and very customizable. Would have been 5 stars but one of the two fans it came with arrived defective. Not a big deal for me because I’m replacing with colored fans anyway, but for someone one a stricter budget, this could be a concern
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Begley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty case with one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to build in and it has a lot of premium features that one one would look for in a decent case. The only gripe u have with it is the fact the front airflow is restricted because of the fact that the is about one inch wide of perforated area running down the right side of the case for the front airflow. Its pretty restricted. I have a fully water-cooled computer so the airflow thing isn't really much of a problem. But that should be taken into consideration when buying the case. My Hyper 212 Evo wasn't enough for my i7 6700k.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Overall, A Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good case for three reasons: -It's spacious to build in -Easy for both first time and experienced builders -the simplicity and build quality is something you'd expect of a $130 case and not a $99 case. My only qualms about the case: -Lack of SSD trays (only two) -fitting a 280mm radiator is a tight fight, but it will fit with some wiggling. I would recommend this case to anyone on a budget who at most want an AIO water cooler. If you want something for a custom loop, I suggest looking at the H700 or other cases of that class.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: The first used one I bought came with missing pieces for the front aio mount but amazon is amazing and send me a replacement asap. Great case, I am not a fan of the nzxt software but works well
customer_reviews.author: BlakeH

customer_reviews.title: Best PC case I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is about my personal 6th build in my life, and doing about 10 for friends and family members. This is the best case I've ever built with that costs less than $100. Great layout and features. Mounting old fashioned HDDs were a little inconvenient, but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaoluobo

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case.
customer_reviews.text: Wire management in this tower was a breeze. Great value, and a good place to start with RGB. One star off because I feel the tower doesn't quite lend itself to other brands of fans or RGB accessories. If you get the H500i, then I would recommend you also use NZXT cooler and RGB fans. If you want to use other brands, then I would recommend getting the H500 and installing your own LED strips.
customer_reviews.author: Mckenzie Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought this case might overheat since the intake space is not very big, but it actually works very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Nam T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a 10/10 case, best case I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: I am still getting computer parts to finish my computer but this is one of the best cases I have ever built a computer with, from the cable management system to the built in led lights, and the versatility of this case is amazing! I would definitely recommend this case to anyone who builds computers or wants a really good looking and easy to use computer case. 10/10 on everything, NZXT is one of my favorite brands for a couple things now!
customer_reviews.author: GamingWithDJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for in order to replace an old one I was tired of looking at. Cable management was really easy and allowed me to make the interior look cleaner. The 2 case fans it comes with work pretty well for cooling, I may add a 3rd just to keep temps relatively lower than they are now. It appears there is only room for 1 fan on the top of the case so any large (280mm) CPU coolers will have to be mounted on the front of the case. Overall I'm really happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Montes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case that makes your PC clean and sexy!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing case! This case really took my PC to another level in the looks department. Installing all the components was super easy and managing the cables was a breeze. Only thing I disliked was that the thumbscrews for the case were not easy to unscrew but that is not a big enough reason to not buy the case.
customer_reviews.author: JT Garza

customer_reviews.title: Simple and clean!
customer_reviews.text: How can anyone not love this case? Clean and simple design. Stupid easy cable management, so if you dont have a modular PSU, this is the case for you! Only issue I had with the case (which is more of a preference issue), is I wish it accommodate 1 more fan up top.
customer_reviews.author: B.Cleary

product_meta.title: NZXT H500 – Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case – Light Up Overwatch Logo - Tempered Glass Panel- Enhanced Cable Management System – Water-Cooling Ready - Overwatch Edition - 2018 Model
product_meta.description: Color:Black/Orange| Size:H500| Style:Non i-SeriesFrom the manufacturer H500 Overwatch Compactatx Mid-Tower Case NZXT and Blizzard Entertainment have joined forces to deliver a PC chassis equipped for an epic Overwatch encounter. The new, special edition H500 Overwatch Edition mid-tower showcases NZXT’s signature design with a unique look that any agent would be proud to have in their arsenal. Featuring an all-steel construction and a cable management system for streamlined building, launching your ultimate PC gaming build has never been easier. Feature List BUBuild Up Your Ultimate PC The H500 Overwatch Edition is available in the signature Black, White, and Orange colors of Overwatch. Its all-steel construction is highlighted by the tempered glass panel, brightly lit Overwatch logo, and iconic cable bar to showcase your beautiful build. Enjoyable Builds For All We designed a cable routing system with pre-installed channels and straps on the back of the motherboard tray, for intuitive and easy wiring. We also upgraded our signature cable bar to be adjustable to simplify the building process. Streamlined Cooling A front bracket designed for radiators up to 280mm makes installing water-cooling simple. There’s also an integrated reservoir mount for custom-loop systems. Two Aer F 120mm fans are included for optimal internal airflow and the front and PSU intakes include removable filters Color:Orange/Black/White | Size:H500 | Style:Non i-Series NZXT and Blizzard Entertainment have joined forces to deliver a PC chassis equipped for an epic Over watch encounter. The new, special editionH500Overwatch Edition mid-tower showcases NZXT’s signature design with a unique look that any agent would be proud to have in their arsenal. Featuring an all-steel construction and a cable management system for streamlined building, launching your ultimate PC gaming build has never been easier.
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY: All-steel construction with brightly lit Over watch logo; available in the signature Black, White, and Orange colors of Over watch
MODERN STORAGE: The H500’s layout for storage optimizes airﬂow and interior space for a clean-looking build.
FULL TEMPERED GLASS PANEL: Showcase your build with crisp clarity
ALL-NEW CABLE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM: Features dual-position cable management bar and cable routing kit located behind motherboard tray. Velcro straps allow you to make changes on the fly
WATER-COOLING READY: Installation simplified for both AIO and custom loop configurations

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,300 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
